Class Overview

montecarlo.SpinConfig1D([N, pbc])

1-D spin configuration

montecarlo.SpinConfig()

Base class for different types of spin configurations (i.e., 1D, 2D, etc)

montecarlo.IsingHamiltonian1D([J, mu, pbc])

Class for 1D Hamiltonian

1-D spin configuration

Initialize instance

Parameters

  • N (int, default: 10) – Number of sites

  • pbc (bool, default: true) – Should we use periodic boundary conditions?

Parameters

Parameters

set configuration to bitstring of int

Parameters

int_index (int, required) – integer whose bit representation corresponds to desired spin configuration

class montecarlo.IsingHamiltonian1D(J=1.0, mu=0.0, pbc=True)[source]

Class for 1D Hamiltonian

\[H = -J\sum_{\left<ij\right>} \sigma_i\sigma_j + \mu\sum_i\sigma_i\]
__init__(J=1.0, mu=0.0, pbc=True)[source]

Constructor

Parameters

  • J (float, optional) – Strength of coupling

  • mu (float, optional) – Chemical potential

  • pbc (bool, optional, default=true) – Do PBC?

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

Compute Average values exactly

Parameters

  • conf (SpinConfig1D) – input configuration

  • T (int) – Temperature

Returns

  • E (float) – Energy

  • M (float) – Magnetization

  • HC (float) – Heat Capacity

  • MS (float) – Magnetic Susceptability

delta_e_for_flip(i, config)[source]

Compute the energy change incurred if one were to flip the spin at site i

Parameters

  • config (SpinConfig1D) – input configuration

Returns

energy – Returns both the flipped config and the energy change
